definition: four horse military chariot (archaic)/four (archaic)/generic term for history books
to ride/to mount/to make use of/to avail oneself of/to take advantage of/to multiply (math.)/Buddhist sect or creed
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: A times table isn't the most common need for a method.
sentences.chinese: 使用方法時，人們最希望獲得的結果並非總是乘法表。

sentences.english: The teacher hammered away at the multiplication tables.
The teacher drilled grammar and the multiplication tables every day.
sentences.chinese: 教員每天通過練習傳授語法和乘法表。

sentences.english: The teacher quizzed the pupils on the multiplication tables.
sentences.chinese: 我們老師過去老是讓我們反覆背誦乘法表。

sentences.english: My grandfather used this to teach my multiplication table when I was little.
sentences.chinese: 我年紀還小時，我的祖父用這個教我的乘法表。
他把二的乘法表背誦下來了。

definition: four rules of arithmetic/addition, subtraction, multiplication and division
(math.) the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter (π)
to learn by rote/to mechanically memorize
to pronounce a word after mentally processing its spelling/(phonics) blending
new character (in textbook)/character that is unfamiliar or not yet studied
